attributes.comment:
I believe the proposed fee increase for most immigration services is unwise. An
increase in the fees will only encourage more document fraud and illegal entry as
it will close the door to those who the US has the most problem with, the
Seasonal and Temporary Workers for which much debate has been had to make
a guest worker visa. Most of the proposed fees raise those that are most vital
and important to continue smooth immigration and to get the majority of
immigrants on the right track. It will target individuals, not companies, who are
not best or able to cover such expenses. While it should be noted that
citizenship costs alot to administer, it costs more to continue to monitor residents
as the comply with registration, moves, commit crimes, and other problems. As
residents become citizens, the load of supervision the Agency must monitor
becomes less. Why discourage those who would qualify? Similarly why increase
adjustments so high that it is cheaper to buy really good looking documents on
the street?

Most of my clients complain about my fees in addition to the already large fees to
adjudicate applications. However, corporate clients, while complain are more than
willing to pay the fees if they get quality service. That is not happening right now
and until it does, the fees should not change. Aliens and corporations should not
pay for the wall that Congress has already allocated money for.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Steven R. Lawrence
